answers.a: Receiving end voltage is less than sending end voltage.
answers.b: Receiving end voltage is greater than sending end voltage.
answers.c: Sending end current is greater than receiving end current.
answers.d: Power factor becomes leading at the sending end.

explanations.a: Incorrect – this is a typical voltage drop.
explanations.b: Correct – this defines the Ferranti Effect.
explanations.d: Incorrect – power factor can be leading but doesn't define the effect.

questions.question: Which device is commonly used to mitigate the Ferranti Effect?

explanations.a: Incorrect – series capacitors can worsen it.
explanations.b: Correct – shunt reactors absorb leading reactive power.
explanations.c: Incorrect – used for voltage regulation under load.
explanations.d: Incorrect – resistors cause voltage drop, not suitable for this problem.
